intro: Gagea punjabica, commonly known as the Punjab glory-of-the-snow, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Pakistan and Afghanistan. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in cold, arid environments, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Gagea punjabica is valued for its ornamental flowers and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
